mesquite.lib.characters

Interface SlicedCharacterHistory

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AdjustableDistribution, CharacterHistory, CharacterStatesHolder, Explainable, Listable, Renamable, WithStringDetails

    public interface SlicedCharacterHistory
extends CharacterHistory
    A CharacterHistory that can indicate changes within branches, e.g.for stochastic character mapping

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      CharacterState[] getStateSequenceOnBranch(int it)

    • Method Detail

      • getStateSequenceOnBranch

        CharacterState[] getStateSequenceOnBranch(int it)
        gets the sequence of character states along the branch below node it, starting with the ancestral node and going up. The first state is the first change since the ancestral node. The particular data types (e.g. continuous, categorical) can have additional more efficient methods, e.g. returning a double[] or long[]

      • getTimeSequenceOnBranch

        double[] getTimeSequenceOnBranch(int it)
        gets the timing of the changes of character states along the branch below node it. Element i is the time of acquisition of the state of element i from the array returned by getStateSequenceOnBranch. This should be in fractions of the branch's length. Any elements not corresponding to a state (e.g. extra spaces in the array) should be filled with -1
